intro: Pisonia aculeata f. inermis, commonly known as the smooth pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
